parameters: What is with this creepy ass hallway?
Why is the lighting so dim??
The sconces just aren’t very powerful...
I guess this is the taxidermy you were referring to.
It's a Jenny Haniver, isn't it?
Yes. I could cover it or move it, if you want.
It's a little creepy, but if you like it...
I first saw a Jenny Haniver in a museum when I was nine.
I was petrified. I couldn’t even believe it was real.
It was like something straight out of a nightmare.
I refused to pass through the room it was displayed in.
I was usually an agreeable child, so this offended my mother greatly.
She would cite my behavior as the reason for her overdosing on painkillers later that evening.
I mean, sounds like projection to me.
She was raising three small children by herself and pregnant again at the time.
It's not difficult to push someone over the edge when they're constantly teetering there.
But I developed a real phobia of this thing. It haunted me for years.
I thought it cursed me into trying to get my mother killed.
I don’t like being irrational. So I got one, and I keep it somewhere I have to see it every day.
Kinda like doing your own exposure therapy.
In the past, yes. That was the idea. I've made progress with both of my phobias.
As I get older, I feel giving in to the compulsion to own one may have just been yet another irrational decision.
So you keep it around now, like, what, out of spite?
I’m not scared of the manta ray, which is what this actually is.
I’m not scared of the person who salted and carved its corpse.
I was scared initially, but punishment for my fear was what created a complex.
I think I know what you're saying.
You don’t have to keep stuff if it’s just bothering you, though.
I am not afraid of it now. It cannot hurt me.
It is the people I care about who can hurt me. Those sorts of social phobias are much harder to overcome.
Besides, I prefer this rendition of an angel to the way my birth religion does it.
If angels existed, they probably wouldn't look like men and women in white robes.
Yeah. At least, I hope so.
Like, you wanna be stuck in this body for eternity? Really?
They should hold forms the average human struggles to comprehend.
They should strike fear into the hearts of the close-minded.
They should inspire awe in those who can appreciate them as they are.
Yeah. Yeah. Ethereal, or horrifying, or both.
They get a bad rap. Totally unwarranted.
You're right, and I know it, and I'm trying.
We have things in common. The brown recluse spider, for example.
Being so reclusive your whole genus is named for it is something I can relate to.
Yeah. That's like me with the "confused beetle."
I have very generously allowed a spider to reside in my garage. You may have seen it.
Want me to relocate her for you?
I don't wanna walk closer to that thing if I don't have to, honestly.
There just hasn't been much reason to decorate this hallway. No one but me ever sees it.
What is with this creepy ass hallway?
Why is the lighting so dim??
The sconces just aren’t very powerful...
